alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ulster County through 315 PM EDT... At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Plattekill, or near Walden, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and in urban/poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... New Paltz, Wallkill, Plattekill, Highland, Modena, Marlboro, Lloyd, Gardiner, Tuckers Corner, Flint, Lattintown, Forest Glen, Rutsonville, Galeville, Lake Minnewaska, Elting Corners, Ireland Corners, Stoneco, Ardonia and Sylva. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
